paragraphs.text: Sokka never had the chance to perform the ice dodging ceremony as his father, Hakoda, left the Southern Water Tribe before Sokka had reached the required age. However, in early 100 AG, the young warrior encountered one of his father's old friends, Bato, who, upon realizing that Sokka had never completed his rite of passage, suggested that Sokka and his friends perform a variation of the ritual, dodging jagged rocks instead of icebergs, with Bato himself standing in for Hakoda. Accepting Bato's offer, Sokka performed the ritual. He steered the boat and coordinated Katara, who took the mainsail, and Aang, who controlled the jib. With teamwork and Sokka's decisive leadership, the group completed the ritual without injury, even performing beyond what was required in order to pass. Sokka was awarded the Mark of the Wise, Aang the Mark of the Trusted, and Katara the Mark of the Brave.
